newsitem.title: GERMANY: Police detain two protesters at Berlin G7 meeting.
newsitem.headline: Police detain two protesters at Berlin G7 meeting.

text.p: Police detained two people on Saturday as 300 anarchists staged an anti-capitalist protest in Berlin outside a meeting of financial leaders from the world's seven most industrialised nations, the G7.

About 300 anarchists and punks donning rainbow-coloured hair and black ragged clothes marched through the centre of Berlin and stopped outside the Kronprinzenpalais (Crown Prince Palace), where the G7 meeting was taking place.
Some carried banners with anti-capitalist slogans, such as: "They tread on corpses to give money to the rich". Scuffles broke out between protesters and police but noone was injured.

Police detained the two because they had broken a law requiring demonstrators to make themselves clearly identifiable. Police did not say how they were disguised, but some protesters had covered their heads with scarves.
The demonstration later broke up and a large contingent marched on to west Berlin to join an anti-nuclear protest there.
